title: (x) IS246 Jingle Bells - Autoscape {Yves}
content:
The small text that says "view this disc online" is in ITC Lubalin Graph, the slab-serif cousin of Avant Garde.   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-lubalin-graph/book/testdrive.html?s=view+this+disc+online&p=24](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224108/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-lubalin-graph/book/testdrive.html?s=view%2Bthis%2Bdisc%2Bonline&p=24)
author: marcox

comments.content:
Here's what I got when I went to the lineto site:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224108im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/37524.jpg)

That's really similar to [close](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224108/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/closecall.asp), which is free from fountain. That could be a nice alternative to spending a small fortune over at lineto.

You can check out the numbers and uppercase by using Lineto's Typewriter feature. It's definitely Autoscape, though -- I created this sample at lineto.com:   
   
 ![autoscape.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224108im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/37570.gif)
